titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York University Archives Collection of Course Bulletins MC.286
titlestmt.author: John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-11 08:32:27 -0500.

change.item: Additional material added to the collection by John Zarrillo
Updated by Amy C. Vo to reflect integration of material from the 2020.003 accretion
Updated by John Zarrillo to reflect integration of material found in collection (box 195)
Updated by Nicole Greenhouse to reflect the integration of archived websites into the collection

did.unittitle: New York University Archives Collection of Course Bulletins
did.abstract: The collection consists of publications (bulletins, catalogs, announcements, etc.) that outline the course of study at New York University and its component schools, dating from 1832 to the present day. The publications are a mix of bound and unbound materials, as well as electronic records in the PDF format and websites containing details about course offerings at NYU. They typically include an overview of the school, degree requirements, lists of faculty and administrators, and course descriptions. Early publications sometimes include lists of students and degrees conferred.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and Mandarin.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material pertaining to individual student records may be restricted in accordance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Please contact the Archives with specific questions regarding access to such records.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection which were created prior to 1924 are in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.

Materials that were published in 1924 or later are potentially protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Additional duplicate copies of publications are held in the collection of New York University Publications (preservation copies) (RG 1.0).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. Material from 2020 accretion was donated by Richard Carreno in July 2019. The accession number associated with this donation is 2020.003.

Prior to 2018, websites were initially selected by curators and captured through the use of the Internet Archive's Archive-it service. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In 2019, accessioning information for archived websites were recorded. Websites were added either due to content drift, link rot, or were selected by the University Archivist. The accession numbers associated with these websites are 2019.090, 2019.091, 2019.092, 2019.098, 2019.099, 2019.100, 2019.101, 2019.102, 2019.103, 2019.104, 2019.105, 2019.117, 2019.127, 2019.129, 2019.132, 2020.003, 2020.010, 2020.022, 2020.024, 2020. 026, 2020.028, 2020.031, 2021.010, 2021.013, 2021.018, 2021.023, 2021.024, 2021.025, 2021.026, 2021.027, 2021.028, 2021.029, 2021.030, 2021.031, 2021.032, 2021.034, 2021.035.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Collection of Course Bulletins; MC 286; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
To cite the archived website in this collection: Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Collection of Course Bulletins; MC 286; Wayback URL; Repository Name, New York University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into series based on the New York University Archives's record group classification system, then by date. Titles for the record groups are based on the school or program's current official name (as of 2019). For example, School of Commerce bulletins are included as part of the Stern School of Business record group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of publications (bulletins, catalogs, announcements, etc.) that outline the course of study at New York University and its component schools, dating from 1832 to the present day. The publications are a mix of bound and unbound materials, as well as electronic records in the PDF format and websites containing details about course offerings at NYU. They typically include an overview of the school, degree requirements, lists of faculty and administrators, and course descriptions. Early publications sometimes include lists of students and degrees conferred.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was assembled by the New York University Archives staff. It was collectively referred to as "Series 3: Bulletins, Catalogs, Announcements" through 2018. This designation may appear on boxes and folders in the current collection.
In May 2019 additional course bulletins were discovered in the University Archives and were integrated into this collection.
In 2021, the archived websites captured in the University Archives: Course Listings, Bulletins and Descriptions Archive-it Collection were integrated into MC 286 according to record group.

dao.xlink:title: Courant Institute Educational Programs Archived Website

daodesc.p: Courant Institute Educational Programs Archived Website: May 2014-May 2016

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences is a center for research and advanced training in mathematics and computer science. The Institute has long been a leader in mathematical analysis, applied mathematics, and scientific computation, with special emphasis on partial differential equations and their applications. In computer science, the Institute excels in theory, programming languages, computer graphics, and parallel computing. Mathematics and computer science are viewed as living parts of the stream of science, not as isolated specialties. They offer Master of Science (M.S.) and Ph.D. programs in both mathematics and computer science. Courant is affiliated with the Graduate School of Arts and Science.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Institute for the Study of the Ancient World is a center for advanced scholarly research and graduate education, intended to cultivate comparative and connective investigations of the ancient world. It will feature doctoral and postdoctoral programs, with the aim of training a new generation of scholars who will enter the global academic community and become intellectual leaders.

daodesc.p: School of Law Academic Services Archived Website: May 2014-September 2016

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This site contains course descriptions, academic policies and other academic resources for students. The School of Law is one of the oldest law schools in the United States. It offers a comprehensive first professional program leading to the degree of Juris Doctor and a graduate curriculum leading to the degrees of Master of Laws, Master of Comparative Jurisprudence, and Doctor of Juridical Science.

dao.xlink:title: School of Law Course Descriptions Archived Website

daodesc.p: School of Law Course Descriptions Archived Website: July 2014-ongoing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Website containing course descriptions for NYU Law. It contains a listing of required first year courses, course syllabi and assignments, course schedules, course updates, course evaluations, and learning outcomes. Course topics include Administrative Law, Antitrust and Competition Law, Bankruptcy and Creditors' Rights, Civil Procedure, Civil Rights, Clinical Programs, Comparative and Foreign Law, Constitutional Law, Contracts and Commercial Law, Corporate and Securities Law, Corporate Compliance and Enforcement, Criminal Law and Administration, Democracy and Law, Environmental and Energy Law, Evidence, Family Law, First-Year, Health and Benefits Law, Human Rights, Immigration Law, Intellectual Property and Information Law, International Law, International Litigation and Arbitration, Labor and Employment Law, Lawyering and Simulation, Legal Theory and Legal History, Professional Responsibility, Property, Land Use, and Urban Affairs, Security and Law, Stern Business School Preferential, Taxation, Torts and Insurance, Transactional and Law and Business, and Wagner Graduate School Preferential. Access to the course descriptions is easiest accessible from the Schedule of Courses/Course Schedules page.

dao.xlink:title: Steinhardt School Bulletin Archived Website

daodesc.p: Steinhardt School Bulletin Archived Website: April 2014-October 2019

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: NYU Steinhardt offers undergraduate, master's, advanced certificate, and doctoral degree programs in applied psychology, the visual and performing arts and arts professions, education, health, and media. Undergraduate programs combine inquiry in the liberal arts and sciences, mastery of a specific field of study, global study, and applied learning, internship, and other fieldwork experiences. Graduate programs range from those that emphasize advanced research and scholarship to those that prepare students for advanced professional practice and leadership. Many graduate programs are interdisciplinary and include unique opportunities for global learning and research.

did.unittitle: Polytechnic Undergraduate and Graduate Bulletin (with addenda)

dao.xlink:title: Polytechnic Undergraduate and Graduate Bulletin (with addenda) Archived Website

daodesc.p: Polytechnic Undergraduate and Graduate Bulletin (with addenda) Archived Website: May 2014-August 2018

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The New York University Polytechnic School of Engineering bulletin/catalog is an official publication of NYU. It provides information about academic programs and a summary of Institute policies and procedures and selected activities and services. Information concerning admission, academic regulations and requirements, student services, academic offerings and a listing of administrative officers and faculty are included. Every effort has been made to publish a complete and accurate catalog. However, requirements, deadlines, tuition, fees, curricula, courses and staffing are subject to change at any time without advance notice or obligation. Some course descriptions may vary from actual course content because of advancements in the discipline, emphasis of individual instructors or decisions of the faculty to change the scope or content of the course. NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering is a comprehensive school of engineering, applied sciences, technology and research, and is rooted in a 158-year tradition of invention, innovation and entrepreneurship. The institution, founded in 1854, is the nation's second-oldest private engineering school. In addition to its main campus in New York City at MetroTech Center in downtown Brooklyn, it also offers programs at sites throughout the region, around the globe and remotely through online learning. The NYU School of Engineering is an integral part of NYU Abu Dhabi, NYU Shanghai, and the NYU Center for Urban Science and Progress (CUSP) in downtown Brooklyn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is the core curriculum page for New York University's Shanghai campus, which details general education requirements like Social & Cultural Foundations, Writing, Mathematics, Science, Algorithmic Thinking, and Language requirements. There is also information about specific courses that will fulfill these requirements and a short video by the academic advising office that discusses the NYU Shanghai core curriculum.

daodesc.p: NYU Shanghai PhD Programs Archived Website: March 2019-ongoing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This page details PhD programs offered by NYU Shanghai, with links to pages for the individual programs detailing current supervising faculty, program structure, applications information, and profiles of current students. PhD programs include biology, chemistry, computer science, data science, mathematics, neural science, physics, and transportation planning and engineering.

did.unittitle: Rory Meyers College of Nursing Academic Bulletin

dao.xlink:title: Rory Meyers College of Nursing Academic Bulletin Archived Website

daodesc.p: Rory Meyers College of Nursing Academic Bulletin Archived Website: April 2014-August 2018

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The College of Nursing (NYUCN) offers a Bachelor of Science Degree with the major in Nursing; Master of Science and Post-Master's Advanced Certificate Programs; a Doctor of Philosophy in Research Theory and Development and a Doctor of Nursing Practice degree. The NYUCN, advancing humane and quality health care for a global society, is the strategic choice for nursing education in the 21st century.
